                                 Release Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
ORIGINAL TITLE:  	The Last Wave
COUNTRY:                Australia
DIRECTOR:               Peter Weir
SCREENWRITER:           Peter Weir, Tony Morphett, Petru Popescu
COMPOSER:               Charles Wain
CINEMATOGRAPHER:        Russell Boyd & Ron Taylor
CAST:                   Richard Chamberlain, Olivia Hamnett, David Gulpilil,     
                        Frederick Parslow, Vivean Gray
GENRE:                  Mystery / Fantasy

SYNOPSIS:
   Peter Weir follows up on his critically acclaimed masterpiece Picnic at 
Hanging Rock with this surrealist psychological drama. The film opens with a 
freak hailstorm in Australia&#039;s outback. Cut to David Burton (Richard 
Chamberlain), a well-to-do Sydney corporate lawyer plagued by visions of 
impending doom who is assigned to defend five accused of murdering a fellow 
Aborigine. The case itself proves to be mysterious -- no exact cause of death 
can be determined by the pathologist, and the accused remain strangely 
tight-lipped about the whole affair. As his visions grow increasingly weird and 
intense, Burton sees in his dream one of the five Aborigines, Chris (David 
Gulpili of Walkabout fame), who is drenched and clutching a sacred rock. 
Burton&#039;s interest in the case slides into complete obsession, and he comes to 
believe that not only was the murder related to an underground urban tribe of 
Aborigines but that Australia is about to be decimated by a massive, apocalyptic 
tidal wave.
